Articles.Content:
> 
> So messing around with your mods a bit and let's just say:
> "Pluron-Khato, meet Plock-Chirkin (and Gyx)."
> 
> [http://imgur.com/a/XDoRu](http://imgur.com/a/XDoRu)

If you are interested in using the barycenter I can help you integrating it in your mod

Sigma Mod Expansion v0.6

[TABLE=width: 100%]

[TR]

[TD]OPM Expansion v0.6

- Rearranged the folders to allow better modularity
- Improved MM configs (no more :FINAL)
- Moved Flags inside the OPM Expansion Folder
- PluronKhato is now compatible with Stock KSP

[/TD]

[TD]RemoteTech Expansion v0.3

- Added back Remote Tech Expansion
- Improved MM configs (no more :FINAL)
- Remote Tech Antennas now are compatible with Stock KSP
- Converted textures to DDS

[/TD]

[/TR]

[/TABLE]

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T18:12:25Z" title="06/18/2015 06:12  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by Sigma88**

> 
> As I CBB with micromanagement involved with playing with RT, I'd like to see some of those antennas available for us mere [AntennaRange](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/56440)users. TIA.

AntennaRange compatibility config is ready, it will be added to the next release ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

this is the code if you want to use it right away ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> @PART[mediumDishAntenna2]:FOR[SigmaRTA]:NEEDS[AntennaRange]:NEEDS[!RemoteTech]  
> {  
>  @rescaleFactor = 0.6  
>  @MODULE[ModuleDataTransmitter]  
>  {  
>  @name = ModuleLimitedDataTransmitter  
>  nominalRange = 135000  
>  simpleRange = 40000000  
>  maxPowerFactor = 4  
>  maxDataFactor = 8  
>  }  
>  MODULE  
>  {  
>  name = ModuleScienceContainer  
>  dataIsCollectable = true  
>  dataIsStorable = false  
>  storageRange = 2  
>  }  
> }  
> @PART[mediumDishAntennaR]:FOR[SigmaRTA]:NEEDS[AntennaRange]:NEEDS[!RemoteTech]  
> {  
>  @rescaleFactor = 0.7  
>  @MODULE[ModuleDataTransmitter]  
>  {  
>  @name = ModuleLimitedDataTransmitter  
>  nominalRange = 1800000  
>  simpleRange = 150000000  
>  maxPowerFactor = 4  
>  maxDataFactor = 8  
>  }  
>  MODULE  
>  {  
>  name = ModuleScienceContainer  
>  dataIsCollectable = true  
>  dataIsStorable = false  
>  storageRange = 2  
>  }  
> }  
> @PART[mediumDishAntennaG]:FOR[AntennaRange]:NEEDS[!RemoteTech]  
> {  
>  @rescaleFactor = 0.8  
>  @MODULE[ModuleDataTransmitter]  
>  {  
>  @name = ModuleLimitedDataTransmitter  
>  nominalRange = 22500000  
>  simpleRange = 500000000  
>  maxPowerFactor = 4  
>  maxDataFactor = 8  
>  }  
>  MODULE  
>  {  
>  name = ModuleScienceContainer  
>  dataIsCollectable = true  
>  dataIsStorable = false  
>  storageRange = 2  
>  }  
> }  
> @PART[mediumDishAntennaB]:FOR[SigmaRTA]:NEEDS[AntennaRange]:NEEDS[!RemoteTech]  
> {  
>  @rescaleFactor = 0.9  
>  @MODULE[ModuleDataTransmitter]  
>  {  
>  @name = ModuleLimitedDataTransmitter  
>  nominalRange = 270000000  
>  simpleRange = 2000000000  
>  maxPowerFactor = 4  
>  maxDataFactor = 8  
>  }  
>  MODULE  
>  {  
>  name = ModuleScienceContainer  
>  dataIsCollectable = true  
>  dataIsStorable = false  
>  storageRange = 2  
>  }  
> }
> 
> 
>     
> 
> 
>
Hello, Sigma. I was wondering... when it's released, can you make a ÃŽÂ£ME for the Planet Mod I'm contributing to? (Stockalike GP2)

> 
> Hello, Sigma. I was wondering... when it's released, can you make a ÃŽÂ£ME for the Planet Mod I'm contributing to? (Stockalike GP2)

The stuff I release is cfg modifications I make for myself and then share with the community

I will gladly try your mod

If I feel like it could use some extra feature, I will run it by you. If you like the idea you will have the choice to add the feature to your mod directly or let me release it as an expansion.

I do this for every expansion, just to be sure the mod devs are fine with that.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-17T17:49:35Z" title="06/17/2015 05:49  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 17, 2015</time> by Sigma88**
Expansion would be fine. Just an expansion.

> 
> Expansion would be fine. Just an expansion.

Do you have something specific in mind?

Eros, Comet Chury, Vesta, Comet Halley, Pluto, Triton, (for GP3) and Callisto (for Jool) analogues for [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125394-WIP-Stockalike-Gas-Planet-2-with-Kopernicus-dev-thread-Nova-s-original-planets](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125394-WIP-Stockalike-Gas-Planet-2-with-Kopernicus-dev-thread-Nova-s-original-planets)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T01:55:19Z" title="06/18/2015 01:55  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by Interplanet Janet**

> 
> Callisto (for Jool)

Way ahead of you.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/8UY0B)

I knew about that. And really, would you like to contribute?

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125394-WIP-Stockalike-Gas-Planet-2-with-Kopernicus-dev-thread-Nova-s-original-planets%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125394-WIP-Stockalike-Gas-Planet-2-with-Kopernicus-dev-thread-Nova-s-original-planets%21)

Maybe give advice for configs and stuff, or maybe help with planet ideas, as well as me?

I think Augustus should handle configs, and I could also handle the planet/satellite/sub-satellite descriptions.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T23:34:48Z" title="06/18/2015 11:34  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by Interplanet Janet**

> 
> I knew about that. And really, would you like to contribute?
> [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125394-WIP-Stockalike-Gas-Planet-2-with-Kopernicus-dev-thread-Nova-s-original-planets%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125394-WIP-Stockalike-Gas-Planet-2-with-Kopernicus-dev-thread-Nova-s-original-planets%21)
> 
> Maybe give advice for configs and stuff, or maybe help with planet ideas, as well as me?
> 
> I think Augustus should handle configs, and I could also handle the planet/satellite/sub-satellite descriptions.

honestly doing ÃŽÂ£ME takes up almost all my free time and I'm also working on my own planet pack, but If I get some bonus time I will make sure to come visit your thread and dropping some tips or ideas

> 
> I knew about that. And really, would you like to contribute?
> [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125394-WIP-Stockalike-Gas-Planet-2-with-Kopernicus-dev-thread-Nova-s-original-planets%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125394-WIP-Stockalike-Gas-Planet-2-with-Kopernicus-dev-thread-Nova-s-original-planets%21)
> 
> Maybe give advice for configs and stuff, or maybe help with planet ideas, as well as me?
> 
> I think Augustus should handle configs, and I could also handle the planet/satellite/sub-satellite descriptions.

Yes, if you need advice or help with anything, don't be afraid to ask me. If I can't figure out a solution to a problem, then I will be more than happy to point you to someone who can.

Cool! And it's not necessarily **my** mod, it's ThatGuyWithALongUsername's.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T02:48:45Z" title="06/19/2015 02:48  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Interplanet Janet**
Hey, you called? Yeah, I guess expansions would be nice, but that gas planet looks like a good gas planet 3 for later... If you make it a deep blue it would work pretty well.

This still work with the new release of OPM? Is there anything I need to do? The locations of the .bins seem to have changed.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-20T03:22:47Z" title="06/20/2015 03:22  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 20, 2015</time> by Whovian**

Apologies, but I'm a bit confused as to which download link to follow if I want all the things; color, tilt, plu-kha. Is that the "full download" one? Sometimes it's hard to know when you always second guess things and have to be dead sure.

> 
> Apologies, but I'm a bit confused as to which download link to follow if I want all the things; color, tilt, plu-kha. Is that the "full download" one? Sometimes it's hard to know when you always second guess things and have to be dead sure.

The OPM bundle; the full download also includes the RemoteTech expansion. (BTW I'm guessing, but the OPM bundle seems to have all the OPM stuff.)

> 
> The OPM bundle; the full download also includes the RemoteTech expansion. (BTW I'm guessing, but the OPM bundle seems to have all the OPM stuff.)

I figured remote tech would be separate but thank you very muchly.

> 
> This still work with the new release of OPM? Is there anything I need to do? The locations of the .bins seem to have changed.

This release is not 100% compatible with the new kopernicus (used by opm 1.7)

I was ready yesterday but I found a problem with pluronkhato.

The new release should be out later today tho ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Apologies, but I'm a bit confused as to which download link to follow if I want all the things; color, tilt, plu-kha. Is that the "full download" one? Sometimes it's hard to know when you always second guess things and have to be dead sure.

Hi karretch,

If you want all the opm stuff but not remote tech you can download the opm bundle

Since the last release you can mix and match whatever you want, so if in the future you'll want to add remote tech expansion you wont have compatibility problems.

The "Full Download" has everything you can find in the OP

- - - Updated - - -

A little preview of the next release:

- AntennaRange compatibility for my Remote Tech Antennas Expansion

- New Feature for the RemoteTech expansion: Outer Space Comms, a set of three antennas with higher range to probe into deep space

Another quick thing: with Distant Objects, Pluron/Khato seems to be the brightest object in the sky other than the sun:

![uwn4Zyuh.png](http://i.imgur.com/uwn4Zyuh.png)

> 
> Another quick thing: with Distant Objects, Pluron/Khato seems to be the brightest object in the sky other than the sun:
> [http://i.imgur.com/uwn4Zyuh.png](http://i.imgur.com/uwn4Zyuh.png)

thanks for pointing that out, if it's an easy fix I'll include it in the next release which is ready

everything is ready for the next release, I will wait to see if I can get an answer from MOARdV regarding Distant Object Enhancement.

If I don't get a solution soon I will release without that fix and then put out an update later

Sigma Mod Expansion v0.6.5

[TABLE=width: 950]

[TR]

[TD]OPM Expansion v0.6.5

- Fixed PlanetShine compatibility
- Moved Wal.bin in a custom folder
- Fixed PluronKhato's mass to make it compatible with kopernicus 0.0.9

[/TD]

[TD]RemoteTech Expansion v0.4

- Added AntennaRange compatibility to RTAntennas Expansion
- Added a new feature: Outer Space Comms

[/TD]

[/TR]

[/TABLE]

The Remote Tech Expansion Outer Space Comms adds 3 new dish antennas that have range increasingly higher in order to reach planets outside Jool.

Enjoy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-20T23:17:36Z" title="06/20/2015 11:17  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 20, 2015</time> by Sigma88**

> 
> Another quick thing: with Distant Objects, Pluron/Khato seems to be the brightest object in the sky other than the sun:
> [http://i.imgur.com/uwn4Zyuh.png](http://i.imgur.com/uwn4Zyuh.png)

I had a quick exchange of PMs with MOARdV and he managed to solve the flare problem

If you are using SigmaPluronKhato plus [DistantObjectEnhancement](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98943)keep an eye on his thread, a release should come out with the fix to the problem ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

the new Distant Object Enhancement patch solves the bug of the big flare from Pluron-Khato

> 
> I've published DOE v1.5.6 on GitHub and KerbalStuff.
> Changes:
> 
> 
> 
> - **Big flares appearing for small/dim worlds is fixed. Issue #16.**
> - A few changes to hopefully reduce memory footprint when some features are not used.
> - Sky dimming has been changed: Updates are shown immediately when "Apply" is pressed. Sky dimming now affects Tracking Station and Space Center views. Planet dimming near the sun has been tweaked.

many thanks to MOARdV for fixing the problem so quickly!
